description:
In the decade since the world became aware of the existence of magic, the world has undergone massive upheaval. However, a boy named Touta lives in seclusion in a rural town far removed from these changes. His ordinary life is highlighted by his magic-using female teacher and his supportive friends. When his tranquil daily life is disrupted, he embarks on a unique adventure.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

name.native: フェイト・アーウェルンクス
エヴァンジェリン・A.K.・マクダウェル

alternative: That Damn Guy Who You Can Stab With Swords All You Like And It Won't Do A Thing

name.native: ネギ・スプリングフィールド

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KenAkamatsu) | [Website](http://www.ailove.net/main.html) | [Blog](https://kenakamatsu.hatenablog.com/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/Akamatsu.Ken) | [Tumblr](https://kenakamatsu.tumblr.com/)

Ken Akamatsu is a Japanese mangaka from Tokyo.   

In his teenage years, Akamatsu failed the entrance exam to Tokyo University, and applied for Film Study instead (it is speculated that this is where he got the idea for Love Hina). Eventually, he became famous as an illustrator featured in Comiket (short for Comic Market, a comic convention bi-annually held in Japan). He used the pen name Awa Mizuno (水野亜和). Akamatsu, still in college, then proceeded to win the Weekly Shonen Magazine award twice. His "A Kid's Game for One Summer" was awarded the coveted 50th Shonen Magazine Newcomer's Award soon after he graduated.    

After a big hit with A.I. Love You, he finally made a grand success with his new manga, Love Hina. The series appeared in Weekly Shonen Magazine and has been collected in eleven volumes (with fourteen volumes in total), which have sold over 6 million copies in Japan, and received the Kodansha Manga Award for shōnen in 2001.  Akamatsu had added elements of his own life experiences to the story, and this was said to have induced a unique feeling to the manga especially for Western readers, whose lack of familiarity with Japanese culture for the most part added to the effect. The series, published in America in 2002, was especially well received in many overseas countries - Akamatsu was surprised that even foreign readers found Love Hina to be "cute" and to their liking.    

He is now married to his wife 'Kanon' Akamatsu, who was previously a singer/idol.

Since 2022, he has held a seat in the House of Councillors proportional representation block of the National Diet.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KenAkamatsu) | [Website](http://www.ailove.net/main.html) | [Blog](https://kenakamatsu.hatenablog.com/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/Akamatsu.Ken) | [Tumblr](https://kenakamatsu.tumblr.com/)

Ken Akamatsu is a Japanese mangaka from Tokyo.   

In his teenage years, Akamatsu failed the entrance exam to Tokyo University, and applied for Film Study instead (it is speculated that this is where he got the idea for Love Hina). Eventually, he became famous as an illustrator featured in Comiket (short for Comic Market, a comic convention bi-annually held in Japan). He used the pen name Awa Mizuno (水野亜和). Akamatsu, still in college, then proceeded to win the Weekly Shonen Magazine award twice. His "A Kid's Game for One Summer" was awarded the coveted 50th Shonen Magazine Newcomer's Award soon after he graduated.    

After a big hit with A.I. Love You, he finally made a grand success with his new manga, Love Hina. The series appeared in Weekly Shonen Magazine and has been collected in eleven volumes (with fourteen volumes in total), which have sold over 6 million copies in Japan, and received the Kodansha Manga Award for shōnen in 2001.  Akamatsu had added elements of his own life experiences to the story, and this was said to have induced a unique feeling to the manga especially for Western readers, whose lack of familiarity with Japanese culture for the most part added to the effect. The series, published in America in 2002, was especially well received in many overseas countries - Akamatsu was surprised that even foreign readers found Love Hina to be "cute" and to their liking.    

He is now married to his wife 'Kanon' Akamatsu, who was previously a singer/idol.

Since 2022, he has held a seat in the House of Councillors proportional representation block of the National Diet.

[Website](http://www.chibapro.co.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/chibatetsu/)

A Japanese manga artist famous for his sports stories.

He was born in Chuo, Tokyo, Japan, but lived most of his early childhood in Shenyang, Liaoning when northeast China was colonized by Japan during the Second Sino-Japanese War. His father was working in a paper factory when they lived in China. Two of his younger brothers are manga artists: Akio Chiba and Shigeyuki Chiba (pen name Taro Nami), who is almost completely unknown outside Japan, despite writing many popular sports manga in Japan. Chiba's works include _Ashita no Joe_, his best known work, and _Notari Matsutarou_. Many of his early titles are still in print due to continued popularity.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jumpaoki) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/62166972)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. He is currently the leader of the action animation department at J.C. Staff.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/111209/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

Affiliated with [Yumeta Company](https://anilist.co/studio/96/Yumeta-Company).

Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.
